title: IDA Pro/IDA Python, producing file via terminal
content:
I am using IDA Pro 6.5 and running it via terminal with the following command line switches:

When I ran in batch mode prior to the script, it would generate a .asm file that I would then be able to manipulate. However, now this file doesnâ€™t appear. Is there a quick fix or any IDA Python methods I can include in order to create an output file?

answers_data.content:
Here it is. 
Run it with idal -c -A -S./script.py ./test.bin

```
# I didn't check this code, please use carefully !
# IDAPython documentation is at https://www.hex-rays.com/products/ida/support/idapython_docs/

import idautils
import idc

for ea in idautils.Segments():
    segend = idc.GetSegmentAttr(ea, idc.SEGATTR_END)
    start = ea
    while start < segend:
        idc.MakeCode(start)
        start = idc.FindUnexplored(start+1, idc.SEARCH_DOWN)

idc.GenerateFile(idc.OFILE_ASM, idc.GetInputFile()+".asm", 0, idc.BADADDR, 0)

idc.Exit(0)

```

comments.text: I just debugged the answer to your previous question :)
Thanks! Yes I was working on the GenerateFile function but wasn't quite sure how to get the full functionality.
I don't have idal anywhere inside "/Applications/IDA Pro 7.5", where is this script supposed to be located?
@ZachRiggle Actually any correct(32/64bitwise) ida executable should fit.
@ws It appears the issue is that the binary I wanted is idat not idal.  Thanks in any case! After adjusting my $PATH, now I have: $ which idat == /Applications/IDA Pro 7.5/ida.app/Contents/MacOS/idat
